intro: Acer pseudoplatanus subvar. argenteum, commonly known as the silver maple, is a variant of the common maple tree native to Europe. It is characterized by its distinctive silver-white undersides on its leaves, which give it its common name. The tree typically grows to a height of 15–25 meters and has a broad, spreading crown. Its leaves are palmately lobed with serrated edges and turn vibrant yellow in the autumn. This variety is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and parks.
